title.narrative: Building Resilient Community Ecosystems in the Fight Against Child Labour

description.narrative: Planting Naturals, along with their subsidiary Goldtree, is committed to the sustainable production of 100% organic palm oil and aims to demonstrate that responsibly produced palm oil can bring positive impacts to communities, improving the lives of small-scale farmers. Sierra Leone is one of the poorest countries in the world, badly affected by civil war and Ebola. In Kailahun, smallholder farmers grow and harvest the fruits for processing at Goldtree’s Mill. Here, 30% of the children have no access to quality schooling due to poverty and 93% of youth are jobless. High illiteracy rates, low crop yields, inappropriate farming techniques and lack of business information all contribute to the low-incomes of families.Goldtree has strict policies prohibiting child labour, but it can still occur, particularly as growing and harvesting is done by smallholders. Child labour is caused by poverty and food insecurity, and on subsistence farms, family members will support the harvesting and management of the crops. Children are most at risk when collecting fruits from the oil palm trees, fruit picking from the bunches, or brushing. Action on Poverty-APT works with local partner, MAPCO, in Sierra Leone to create livelihoods through enterprise (including agricultural), access to markets and building rights awareness. This combination of social and economic empowerment is a powerful tool to catalyse long-term positive change. The project will raise awareness among smallholder farmers and communities of negative impacts of work on children and education and raise awareness of child rights. Food production will be increased by establishing vegetable gardens and rice fields and increasing yields through organic methodologies. Training on diets and nutrition will improve food security. Smallholders will learn business skill to sell vegetables and make soap, increasing incomes and reducing the need to use child labour to accrue additional income.
